intro: Psoralidium floribundum, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets and produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
